https://jenkins.openbmc.org/job/ci-repository/54791/ : SUCCESS

Run busctl call if it is failed collect the raw data. 

Santosh/dvenender  data file includes any additionla information , which is not included in the inventory.log?
I looked briefly it was different kind of data, but will take a closer look.

+1
I think we can copy only if the xyz.openbmc_project.Inventory.Manager is not running for some reason i.e busctl will throw an error
if busctl is not running all other plugins also will faile need not go to that level. But if data is duplicate then we can ignore this.

What happens if we are trying to call the above busctl command, and it might fail if PIM is not running for some reason while collecting the BMC dump so, we will lose the preserved data, right? OR preserved data is not required in that case?

@ojayanth @matt in /var/lib/phosphor-inventory-manager we are using to serialize inventory objects using cereal, as we are already collecting inventory data using busctl command this data might not be releavant and not easy to interpret.

probably whould abandon this commit.
I think this would still be useful in cases where PIM did not start properly
Devender, It is good to update plugin as suggested , by adding raw inventory information to suppoirt PIM service related failures or any busctl related failure.
I think you need to validate based on the return value of the add_cmd_output function, right?
I think it worked, I made the busctl command in add_cmd_output to fail and I could see the inventory files being copied, you can check the output in the commit message.
yes as per santosh some times setproperty is not getting reflected it seems so he preferred both the logs. Yes intentionally removed
I think we need to look at why PIM is not persisting the few properties to avoid duplicate data except the non-persisted data.
JS: You can capture the return value of the add_cmd_output so that we can rely on that since the $? store status of the last executed command
reverting back the code, I will fix all the bash warnings in another commit. warnings are there for existing plugins too
